subject: Parenting
title: Co-Sleeping Is Always Dangerous
description: A quick, practical guide to Co-Sleeping Is Always Dangerous.

hook.text: A mother falls asleep breastfeeding. She wakes terrified, convinced she's risked her baby's life.

buildup.text: Western guidelines universally warn against co-sleeping due to suffocation risk.

discovery.text: The risk concentrates in specific conditions: soft bedding, alcohol, smoking, or extreme fatigue.

twist.text: Most of the world co-sleeps safely. Japan has among the lowest SIDS rates and highest co-sleeping rates.

climax.text: Blanket bans ignore context. Risk assessment based on actual conditions is more useful.

punchline.text: Context matters more than blanket rules.

quiz.question: What factors concentrate the risk of co-sleeping?
options: Soft bedding, alcohol, smoking, extreme fatigue
